intro: Guatteria salicifolia var. erosa, commonly known as the erose guatteria, is a species of flowering plant in the family Annonaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, where it typically grows in humid, lowland forests. The plant features simple, alternate leaves with a serrated or erose margin, giving it its varietal name. Its flowers are small and clustered, often greenish-white in color, and it produces berries that are edible for some bird species. This plant plays a role in local ecosystems by providing food and habitat for various wildlife.
